CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1941, pg. 22 reads: "Hand-Picked For The Defense Of The U.S.A. - Six hand-picked students of aviation, preparing for the defense of the democracies and the good old U.S.A., as they appeared last Sunday when they stopped in Pittsburgh en route to Tuskegee Institute where they will continue their studies. The boys were graduated from Chanute Field Training school.  Some day they'll command some of Uncle Sam's flying warships.  Left to right: James A. Tibbs, New Jersey; Paul D. Woodson, Washington, D.C.; Harold A. Garibaldi, California; Clarence S. Dishman, Washington, D.C.; Curtis O. Williams and Joseph T. Hamilton, New York. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left, front row: Clarence S. Dishman, Harriet Lewis, possibly Robert "Bobby" Lewis, Ira F. Lewis, and Curtis O. Williams; second row: Harold A. Garibaldi; third row: Paul D. Woodson; back row: James A. Tibbs and Joseph T. Hamilton, posed in backyard garden of Ira Lewis, 616 Wilkinsburg Avenue, Homewood
